result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph I Goodman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph I Goodman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph I Goodman in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
18 months Probation
DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
$243.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
15R 014403; Absolute sobriety No poss of firearms or any at residence

Pre-trial conference at 07-31-2015 09:45 am.
Return date at 08-12-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph I Goodman appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Puck Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller and intern Rick S.  appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $750 Cash bond.  Atty. Tsai makes bail argument.   File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $150.00 Cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of firearms or at the residence; Absolute Sobriety  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
